intro: Descurainia brachycarpa, commonly known as the short-fruited tansy, is an annual herbaceous plant native to North America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many cruciferous species. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with slender stems and small, green, egg-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in racemes, typical of the family. The plant produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds, contributing to its reproductive strategy.
